medium_description_en: Calculates the total body bicarbonate deficit.

seo.meta_description_en: The Bicarbonate Deficit calculator calculates the total body bicarbonate deficit.
seo.keywords_en: Bicarbonate Deficit, bicarb calc, deficit calc, bicarb deficit calc, hco3 calc, h2co3 calc, bicarb deficit score, bicarb deficit, bicarbonate calc, bicarbonate acidosis, bicarbonate, bicarb by weight, bicarb deficit by weight.

how_to_use.pearls_pitfalls_en: Recall that this is an estimate of total body bicarbonate deficit.

next_steps.advice_en: Bicarbonate is occasionally supplemented in IV fluids but often will improve when the patient's underlying condition is improved.

about.formula_en: Bicarbonate deficit = 0.4 × body weight in kg × (24 – bicarbonate level)

Original/Primary Reference.text: Kurtz I. Acid-Base Case Studies. 2nd Ed. Trafford Publishing (2004); 68:150.

creator_info.about_en: Gregory Schmidt, MD, is a professor of medicine and the director of critical care medicine at the University of Iowa. He researches ICU ultrasound, sepsis therapy, ARDS, and judging the adequacy of volume replacement in patients in shock. Dr. Schmidt’s clinical interests include ECMO, septic shock, fluid management techniques, and analysis of ventilator waveforms on treatment course.
